36#ifndef __sctp_os_userspace_h__
37#define __sctp_os_userspace_h__
38/*
39 * Userspace includes
40 * All the opt_xxx.h files are placed in the kernel build directory.
41 * We will place them in userspace stack build directory.
42 */

44#include <errno.h>

46#if defined(_WIN32)
47#include <winsock2.h>

52#include "user_environment.h"
53typedef CRITICAL_SECTION userland_mutex_t;
54#if WINVER < 0x0600
55enum {
56 C_SIGNAL = 0,
57 C_BROADCAST = 1,
58 C_MAX_EVENTS = 2
59};
60typedef struct
61{
62 u_int waiters_count;
63 CRITICAL_SECTION waiters_count_lock;
64 HANDLE events_[C_MAX_EVENTS];
65} userland_cond_t;
66void InitializeXPConditionVariable(userland_cond_t *);
67void DeleteXPConditionVariable(userland_cond_t *);
68int SleepXPConditionVariable(userland_cond_t *, userland_mutex_t *);
69void WakeAllXPConditionVariable(userland_cond_t *);
70#define InitializeConditionVariable(cond) InitializeXPConditionVariable(cond)
71#define DeleteConditionVariable(cond) DeleteXPConditionVariable(cond)
72#define SleepConditionVariableCS(cond, mtx, time) SleepXPConditionVariable(cond, mtx)
73#define WakeAllConditionVariable(cond) WakeAllXPConditionVariable(cond)
74#else
75#define DeleteConditionVariable(cond)
76typedef CONDITION_VARIABLE userland_cond_t;
77#endif
78typedef HANDLE userland_thread_t;
79#define ADDRESS_FAMILY unsigned __int8
80#define IPVERSION 4
81#define MAXTTL 255
82/* VS2010 comes with stdint.h */
83#if !defined(_MSC_VER) || (_MSC_VER >= 1600)
84#include <stdint.h>
85#else
86typedef unsigned __int64 uint64_t;
87typedef unsigned __int32 uint32_t;
88typedef __int32 int32_t;
89typedef unsigned __int16 uint16_t;
90typedef __int16 int16_t;
91typedef unsigned __int8 uint8_t;
92typedef __int8 int8_t;
93#endif
94#ifndef _SIZE_T_DEFINED
95#typedef __int32 size_t;
96#endif
97typedef unsigned __int32 u_int;
98typedef unsigned char u_char;
99typedef unsigned __int16 u_short;
100typedef unsigned __int8 sa_family_t;
101#ifndef _SSIZE_T_DEFINED
102typedef __int64 ssize_t;
103#endif

216typedef char* caddr_t;

218#define bzero(buf, len) memset(buf, 0, len)
219#define bcopy(srcKey, dstKey, len) memcpy(dstKey, srcKey, len)
220
221#if defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER < 1900) && !defined(__MINGW32__)
222#define SCTP_SNPRINTF(data, size, format, ...) \
223 if (_snprintf_s(data, size, _TRUNCATE, format, __VA_ARGS__) < 0) { \
224 data[0] = '\0'; \
225 }
226#else
227#define SCTP_SNPRINTF(data, ...) \
228 if (snprintf(data, __VA_ARGS__) < 0 ) { \
229 data[0] = '\0'; \
230 }
231#endif

233#define inline __inline
234#define __inline__ __inline
235#define MSG_EOR 0x8 /* data completes record */
236#define MSG_DONTWAIT 0x80 /* this message should be nonblocking */

238#ifdef CMSG_DATA
239#undef CMSG_DATA
240#endif
241/*
242 * The following definitions should apply iff WINVER < 0x0600
243 * but that check doesn't work in all cases. So be more pedantic...
244 */
245#define CMSG_DATA(x) WSA_CMSG_DATA(x)
246#define CMSG_ALIGN(x) WSA_CMSGDATA_ALIGN(x)
247#ifndef CMSG_FIRSTHDR
248#define CMSG_FIRSTHDR(x) WSA_CMSG_FIRSTHDR(x)
249#endif
250#ifndef CMSG_NXTHDR
251#define CMSG_NXTHDR(x, y) WSA_CMSG_NXTHDR(x, y)
252#endif
253#ifndef CMSG_SPACE
254#define CMSG_SPACE(x) WSA_CMSG_SPACE(x)
255#endif

257#define CMSG_LEN(x) WSA_CMSG_LEN(x)

260/**** from sctp_os_windows.h ***************/
261#define SCTP_IFN_IS_IFT_LOOP(ifn) ((ifn)->ifn_type == IFT_LOOP)
262#define SCTP_ROUTE_IS_REAL_LOOP(ro) ((ro)->ro_rt && (ro)->ro_rt->rt_ifa && (ro)->ro_rt->rt_ifa->ifa_ifp && (ro)->ro_rt->rt_ifa->ifa_ifp->if_type == IFT_LOOP)
263
264/*
265 * Access to IFN's to help with src-addr-selection
266 */
267/* This could return VOID if the index works but for BSD we provide both. */
268#define SCTP_GET_IFN_VOID_FROM_ROUTE(ro) \
269 ((ro)->ro_rt != NULL ? (ro)->ro_rt->rt_ifp : NULL)
270#define SCTP_ROUTE_HAS_VALID_IFN(ro) \
271 ((ro)->ro_rt && (ro)->ro_rt->rt_ifp)
272/******************************************/
273
274#define SCTP_GET_IF_INDEX_FROM_ROUTE(ro) 1 /* compiles... TODO use routing socket to determine */

281#define BYTE_ORDER LITTLE_ENDIAN
282#endif

300#define IFNAMSIZ 64
301
302#define random() rand()
303#define srandom(s) srand(s)
304
305#define timeradd(tvp, uvp, vvp) \
306 do { \
307 (vvp)->tv_sec = (tvp)->tv_sec + (uvp)->tv_sec; \
308 (vvp)->tv_usec = (tvp)->tv_usec + (uvp)->tv_usec; \
309 if ((vvp)->tv_usec >= 1000000) { \
310 (vvp)->tv_sec++; \
311 (vvp)->tv_usec -= 1000000; \
312 } \
313 } while (0)
314
315#define timersub(tvp, uvp, vvp) \
316 do { \
317 (vvp)->tv_sec = (tvp)->tv_sec - (uvp)->tv_sec; \
318 (vvp)->tv_usec = (tvp)->tv_usec - (uvp)->tv_usec; \
319 if ((vvp)->tv_usec < 0) { \
320 (vvp)->tv_sec--; \
321 (vvp)->tv_usec += 1000000; \
322 } \
323 } while (0)
324
325/*#include <packon.h>
326#pragma pack(push, 1)*/
327struct ip {
328 u_char ip_hl:4, ip_v:4;
329 u_char ip_tos;
330 u_short ip_len;
331 u_short ip_id;
332 u_short ip_off;
333#define IP_RP 0x8000
334#define IP_DF 0x4000
335#define IP_MF 0x2000
336#define IP_OFFMASK 0x1fff
337 u_char ip_ttl;
338 u_char ip_p;
339 u_short ip_sum;
340 struct in_addr ip_src, ip_dst;
341};
342
343struct ifaddrs {
344 struct ifaddrs *ifa_next;
345 char *ifa_name;
346 unsigned int ifa_flags;
347 struct sockaddr *ifa_addr;
348 struct sockaddr *ifa_netmask;
349 struct sockaddr *ifa_dstaddr;
350 void *ifa_data;
351};
352
353struct udphdr {
354 uint16_t uh_sport;
355 uint16_t uh_dport;
356 uint16_t uh_ulen;
357 uint16_t uh_sum;
358};
359
360struct iovec {
361 size_t len;
362 char *buf;
363};
364
365#define iov_base buf
366#define iov_len len
367
368struct ifa_msghdr {
369 uint16_t ifam_msglen;
370 unsigned char ifam_version;
371 unsigned char ifam_type;
372 uint32_t ifam_addrs;
373 uint32_t ifam_flags;
374 uint16_t ifam_index;
375 uint32_t ifam_metric;
376};
377
378struct ifdevmtu {
379 int ifdm_current;
380 int ifdm_min;
381 int ifdm_max;
382};
383
384struct ifkpi {
385 unsigned int ifk_module_id;
386 unsigned int ifk_type;
387 union {
388 void *ifk_ptr;
389 int ifk_value;
390 } ifk_data;
391};
392#endif

413#include <stdio.h>
414#include <string.h>
415#include <stdbool.h>
416/* #include <sys/param.h> in FreeBSD defines MSIZE */
417/* #include <sys/ktr.h> */
418/* #include <sys/systm.h> */
419#if defined(HAVE_SYS_QUEUE_H)
420#include <sys/queue.h>
421#else
422#include <user_queue.h>
423#endif
424#include <user_malloc.h>
425/* #include <sys/kernel.h> */
426/* #include <sys/sysctl.h> */
427/* #include <sys/protosw.h> */
428/* on FreeBSD, this results in a redefintion of SOCK(BUF)_(UN)LOCK and
429 * uknown type of struct mtx for sb_mtx in struct sockbuf */
430#include "user_socketvar.h" /* MALLOC_DECLARE's M_PCB. Replacement for sys/socketvar.h */
431/* #include <sys/jail.h> */
432/* #include <sys/sysctl.h> */
433#include <user_environment.h>
434#include <user_atomic.h>
435#include <user_mbuf.h>
436/* #include <sys/uio.h> */
437/* #include <sys/lock.h> */
438#if defined(__FreeBSD__) && !defined(__Userspace__)
439#include <sys/rwlock.h>
440#endif
441/* #include <sys/kthread.h> */
442#if defined(__FreeBSD__) && !defined(__Userspace__)
443#include <sys/priv.h>
444#endif
445/* #include <sys/random.h> */
446#include <limits.h>
447/* #include <machine/cpu.h> */
448
449#if defined(__APPLE__)
450/* was a 0 byte file. needed for structs if_data(64) and net_event_data */
451#include <net/if_var.h>
452#endif
453#if defined(__FreeBSD__)
454#include <net/if_types.h>
455/* #include <net/if_var.h> was a 0 byte file. causes struct mtx redefinition */
456#endif
457/* OOTB only - dummy route used at the moment. should we port route to
458 * userspace as well? */
459/* on FreeBSD, this results in a redefintion of struct route */
460/* #include <net/route.h> */
461#if !defined(_WIN32) && !defined(__native_client__)
462#include <net/if.h>
463#include <netinet/in.h>
464#include <netinet/in_systm.h>
465#include <netinet/ip.h>
466#endif

468#include <netinet/ip_icmp.h>
469#else
470#include <user_ip_icmp.h>
471#endif

473#include <user_inpcb.h>

477#if !defined(_WIN32)
478#if defined(INET) || defined(INET6)
479#include <ifaddrs.h>
480#endif

482/* for ioctl */
483#include <sys/ioctl.h>

485/* for close, etc. */
486#include <unistd.h>
487/* for gettimeofday */
488#include <sys/time.h>
489#endif

540#define SCTP_PRINTF(...) \
541 if (SCTP_BASE_VAR(debug_printf)) { \
542 SCTP_BASE_VAR(debug_printf)(__VA_ARGS__); \
543 }

593#include <netinet/sctp_constants.h>
594#if defined(SCTP_DEBUG)
595#define SCTPDBG(level, ...) \
596{ \
597 do { \
598 if (SCTP_BASE_SYSCTL(sctp_debug_on) & level) { \
599 SCTP_PRINTF(__VA_ARGS__); \
600 } \
601 } while (0); \
602}
603#define SCTPDBG_ADDR(level, addr) \
604{ \
605 do { \
606 if (SCTP_BASE_SYSCTL(sctp_debug_on) & level ) { \
607 sctp_print_address(addr); \
608 } \
609 } while (0); \
610}
611#else
612#define SCTPDBG(level, ...)
613#define SCTPDBG_ADDR(level, addr)
614#endif

616#ifdef SCTP_LTRACE_CHUNKS
617#define SCTP_LTRACE_CHK(a, b, c, d) if(sctp_logging_level & SCTP_LTRACE_CHUNK_ENABLE) CTR6(KTR_SUBSYS, "SCTP:%d[%d]:%x-%x-%x-%x", SCTP_LOG_CHUNK_PROC, 0, a, b, c, d)
618#else
619#define SCTP_LTRACE_CHK(a, b, c, d)
620#endif
621
622#ifdef SCTP_LTRACE_ERRORS
623#define SCTP_LTRACE_ERR_RET_PKT(m, inp, stcb, net, file, err) \
624 if (sctp_logging_level & SCTP_LTRACE_ERROR_ENABLE) \
625 SCTP_PRINTF("mbuf:%p inp:%p stcb:%p net:%p file:%x line:%d error:%d\n", \
626 (void *)m, (void *)inp, (void *)stcb, (void *)net, file, __LINE__, err);
627#define SCTP_LTRACE_ERR_RET(inp, stcb, net, file, err) \
628 if (sctp_logging_level & SCTP_LTRACE_ERROR_ENABLE) \
629 SCTP_PRINTF("inp:%p stcb:%p net:%p file:%x line:%d error:%d\n", \
630 (void *)inp, (void *)stcb, (void *)net, file, __LINE__, err);
631#else
632#define SCTP_LTRACE_ERR_RET_PKT(m, inp, stcb, net, file, err)
633#define SCTP_LTRACE_ERR_RET(inp, stcb, net, file, err)
634#endif

636
637/*
638 * Local address and interface list handling
639 */
640#define SCTP_MAX_VRF_ID 0
641#define SCTP_SIZE_OF_VRF_HASH 3
642#define SCTP_IFNAMSIZ IFNAMSIZ
643#define SCTP_DEFAULT_VRFID 0
644#define SCTP_VRF_ADDR_HASH_SIZE 16
645#define SCTP_VRF_IFN_HASH_SIZE 3
646#define SCTP_INIT_VRF_TABLEID(vrf)
647
648#if !defined(_WIN32)
649#define SCTP_IFN_IS_IFT_LOOP(ifn) (strncmp((ifn)->ifn_name, "lo", 2) == 0)
650/* BSD definition */
651/* #define SCTP_ROUTE_IS_REAL_LOOP(ro) ((ro)->ro_rt && (ro)->ro_rt->rt_ifa && (ro)->ro_rt->rt_ifa->ifa_ifp && (ro)->ro_rt->rt_ifa->ifa_ifp->if_type == IFT_LOOP) */
652/* only used in IPv6 scenario, which isn't supported yet */
653#define SCTP_ROUTE_IS_REAL_LOOP(ro) 0
654
655/*
656 * Access to IFN's to help with src-addr-selection
657 */
658/* This could return VOID if the index works but for BSD we provide both. */
659#define SCTP_GET_IFN_VOID_FROM_ROUTE(ro) (void *)ro->ro_rt->rt_ifp
660#define SCTP_GET_IF_INDEX_FROM_ROUTE(ro) 1 /* compiles... TODO use routing socket to determine */
661#define SCTP_ROUTE_HAS_VALID_IFN(ro) ((ro)->ro_rt && (ro)->ro_rt->rt_ifp)
662#endif
663
664/*
665 * general memory allocation
666 */
667#define SCTP_MALLOC(var, type, size, name) \
668 do { \
669 MALLOC(var, type, size, name, M_NOWAIT); \
670 } while (0)
671
672#define SCTP_FREE(var, type) FREE(var, type)
673
674#define SCTP_MALLOC_SONAME(var, type, size) \
675 do { \
676 MALLOC(var, type, size, M_SONAME, (M_WAITOK | M_ZERO)); \
677 } while (0)
678
679#define SCTP_FREE_SONAME(var) FREE(var, M_SONAME)
680
681#define SCTP_PROCESS_STRUCT struct proc *
682
683/*
684 * zone allocation functions
685 */
686
687
688#if defined(SCTP_SIMPLE_ALLOCATOR)
689/*typedef size_t sctp_zone_t;*/
690#define SCTP_ZONE_INIT(zone, name, size, number) { \
691 zone = size; \
692}
693
694/* __Userspace__ SCTP_ZONE_GET: allocate element from the zone */
695#define SCTP_ZONE_GET(zone, type) \
696 (type *)malloc(zone);
697
698
699/* __Userspace__ SCTP_ZONE_FREE: free element from the zone */
700#define SCTP_ZONE_FREE(zone, element) { \
701 free(element); \
702}
703
704#define SCTP_ZONE_DESTROY(zone)
705#else
706/*__Userspace__
707 Compiling & linking notes: Needs libumem, which has been placed in ./user_lib
708 All userspace header files are in ./user_include. Makefile will need the
709 following.
710 CFLAGS = -I./ -Wall
711 LDFLAGS = -L./user_lib -R./user_lib -lumem
712*/
713#include "user_include/umem.h"
714
715/* __Userspace__ SCTP_ZONE_INIT: initialize the zone */
716/*
717 __Userspace__
718 No equivalent function to uma_zone_set_max added yet. (See SCTP_ZONE_INIT in sctp_os_bsd.h
719 for reference). It may not be required as mentioned in
720 http://nixdoc.net/man-pages/FreeBSD/uma_zalloc.9.html that
721 max limits may not enforced on systems with more than one CPU.
722*/
723#define SCTP_ZONE_INIT(zone, name, size, number) { \
724 zone = umem_cache_create(name, size, 0, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, 0); \
725 }
726
727/* __Userspace__ SCTP_ZONE_GET: allocate element from the zone */
728#define SCTP_ZONE_GET(zone, type) \
729 (type *)umem_cache_alloc(zone, UMEM_DEFAULT);
730
731
732/* __Userspace__ SCTP_ZONE_FREE: free element from the zone */
733#define SCTP_ZONE_FREE(zone, element) \
734 umem_cache_free(zone, element);
735
736
737/* __Userspace__ SCTP_ZONE_DESTROY: destroy the zone */
738#define SCTP_ZONE_DESTROY(zone) \
739 umem_cache_destroy(zone);
740#endif

745void *sctp_hashinit_flags(int elements, struct malloc_type *type,
746 u_long *hashmask, int flags);
747void
748sctp_hashdestroy(void *vhashtbl, struct malloc_type *type, u_long hashmask);

750void
751sctp_hashfreedestroy(void *vhashtbl, struct malloc_type *type, u_long hashmask);

754#define HASH_NOWAIT 0x00000001
755#define HASH_WAITOK 0x00000002

758#define SCTP_HASH_INIT(size, hashmark) sctp_hashinit_flags(size, M_PCB, hashmark, HASH_NOWAIT)
759
760#define SCTP_HASH_FREE(table, hashmark) sctp_hashdestroy(table, M_PCB, hashmark)

793/* Mbuf manipulation and access macros */
794#define SCTP_BUF_LEN(m) (m->m_len)
795#define SCTP_BUF_NEXT(m) (m->m_next)
796#define SCTP_BUF_NEXT_PKT(m) (m->m_nextpkt)
797#define SCTP_BUF_RESV_UF(m, size) m->m_data += size
798#define SCTP_BUF_AT(m, size) m->m_data + size
799#define SCTP_BUF_IS_EXTENDED(m) (m->m_flags & M_EXT)
800#define SCTP_BUF_EXTEND_SIZE(m) (m->m_ext.ext_size)
801#define SCTP_BUF_TYPE(m) (m->m_type)
802#define SCTP_BUF_RECVIF(m) (m->m_pkthdr.rcvif)
803#define SCTP_BUF_PREPEND M_PREPEND
804
805#define SCTP_ALIGN_TO_END(m, len) if(m->m_flags & M_PKTHDR) { \
806 MH_ALIGN(m, len); \
807 } else if ((m->m_flags & M_EXT) == 0) { \
808 M_ALIGN(m, len); \
809 }

811#if !defined(_WIN32)
812#define SCTP_SNPRINTF(data, ...) \
813 if (snprintf(data, __VA_ARGS__) < 0) { \
814 data[0] = '\0'; \
815 }
816#endif

818/* We make it so if you have up to 4 threads
819 * writting based on the default size of
820 * the packet log 65 k, that would be
821 * 4 16k packets before we would hit
822 * a problem.
823 */
824#define SCTP_PKTLOG_WRITERS_NEED_LOCK 3

827/*
828 * routes, output, etc.

831typedef struct sctp_route sctp_route_t;
832typedef struct sctp_rtentry sctp_rtentry_t;
833
834static inline void sctp_userspace_rtalloc(sctp_route_t *ro)
835{
836 if (ro->ro_rt != NULL) {
837 ro->ro_rt->rt_refcnt++;
838 return;
839 }
840
841 ro->ro_rt = (sctp_rtentry_t *) malloc(sizeof(sctp_rtentry_t));
842 if (ro->ro_rt == NULL)
843 return;
844
845 /* initialize */
846 memset(ro->ro_rt, 0, sizeof(sctp_rtentry_t));
847 ro->ro_rt->rt_refcnt = 1;
848
849 /* set MTU */
850 /* TODO set this based on the ro->ro_dst, looking up MTU with routing socket */
851#if 0
852 if (userspace_rawroute == -1) {
853 userspace_rawroute = socket(AF_ROUTE, SOCK_RAW, 0);
854 if (userspace_rawroute == -1)
855 return;
856 }
857#endif
858 ro->ro_rt->rt_rmx.rmx_mtu = 1500; /* FIXME temporary solution */
859
860 /* TODO enable the ability to obtain interface index of route for
861 * SCTP_GET_IF_INDEX_FROM_ROUTE macro.
862 */
863}
864#define SCTP_RTALLOC(ro, vrf_id, fibnum) sctp_userspace_rtalloc((sctp_route_t *)ro)
865
866/* dummy rtfree needed once user_route.h is included */
867static inline void sctp_userspace_rtfree(sctp_rtentry_t *rt)
868{
869 if(rt == NULL) {
870 return;
871 }
872 if(--rt->rt_refcnt > 0) {
873 return;
874 }
875 free(rt);
876}
877#define rtfree(arg1) sctp_userspace_rtfree(arg1)
878

887#define SCTP_GATHER_MTU_FROM_ROUTE(sctp_ifa, sa, rt) ((rt != NULL) ? rt->rt_rmx.rmx_mtu : 0)
888
889#define SCTP_GATHER_MTU_FROM_INTFC(sctp_ifn) (sctp_ifn->ifn_mtu)

891#define SCTP_SET_MTU_OF_ROUTE(sa, rt, mtu) do { \
892 if (rt != NULL) \
893 rt->rt_rmx.rmx_mtu = mtu; \
894 } while(0)

897/*************************/
898/* These are for logging */
899/*************************/
900/* return the base ext data pointer */
901#define SCTP_BUF_EXTEND_BASE(m) (m->m_ext.ext_buf)
902 /* return the refcnt of the data pointer */
903#define SCTP_BUF_EXTEND_REFCNT(m) (*m->m_ext.ref_cnt)
904/* return any buffer related flags, this is
905 * used beyond logging for apple only.

907#define SCTP_BUF_GET_FLAGS(m) (m->m_flags)
908
909/* For BSD this just accesses the M_PKTHDR length
910 * so it operates on an mbuf with hdr flag. Other
911 * O/S's may have seperate packet header and mbuf
912 * chain pointers.. thus the macro.
913 */
914#define SCTP_HEADER_TO_CHAIN(m) (m)
915#define SCTP_DETACH_HEADER_FROM_CHAIN(m)
916#define SCTP_HEADER_LEN(m) ((m)->m_pkthdr.len)
917#define SCTP_GET_HEADER_FOR_OUTPUT(o_pak) 0
918#define SCTP_RELEASE_HEADER(m)
919#define SCTP_RELEASE_PKT(m) sctp_m_freem(m)
920
921#define SCTP_GET_PKT_VRFID(m, vrf_id) ((vrf_id = SCTP_DEFAULT_VRFID) != SCTP_DEFAULT_VRFID)
922
923
924
925/* Attach the chain of data into the sendable packet. */
926#define SCTP_ATTACH_CHAIN(pak, m, packet_length) do { \
927 pak = m; \
928 pak->m_pkthdr.len = packet_length; \
929 } while(0)

934/* OOTB only #define SCTP_IS_IT_BROADCAST(dst, m) ((m->m_flags & M_PKTHDR) ? in_broadcast(dst, m->m_pkthdr.rcvif) : 0) BSD def */
935#define SCTP_IS_IT_LOOPBACK(m) 0
936/* OOTB ONLY #define SCTP_IS_IT_LOOPBACK(m) ((m->m_flags & M_PKTHDR) && ((m->m_pkthdr.rcvif == NULL) || (m->m_pkthdr.rcvif->if_type == IFT_LOOP))) BSD def */

948/* is the endpoint v6only? */
949#define SCTP_IPV6_V6ONLY(sctp_inpcb) ((sctp_inpcb)->ip_inp.inp.inp_flags & IN6P_IPV6_V6ONLY)
950/* is the socket non-blocking? */
951#define SCTP_SO_IS_NBIO(so) ((so)->so_state & SS_NBIO)
952#define SCTP_SET_SO_NBIO(so) ((so)->so_state |= SS_NBIO)
953#define SCTP_CLEAR_SO_NBIO(so) ((so)->so_state &= ~SS_NBIO)
954/* get the socket type */
955#define SCTP_SO_TYPE(so) ((so)->so_type)
956
957/* reserve sb space for a socket */
958#define SCTP_SORESERVE(so, send, recv) soreserve(so, send, recv)
959
960/* wakeup a socket */
961#define SCTP_SOWAKEUP(so) wakeup(&(so)->so_timeo, so)
962/* clear the socket buffer state */
963#define SCTP_SB_CLEAR(sb) \
964 (sb).sb_cc = 0; \
965 (sb).sb_mb = NULL; \
966 (sb).sb_mbcnt = 0;
967
968#define SCTP_SB_LIMIT_RCV(so) so->so_rcv.sb_hiwat
969#define SCTP_SB_LIMIT_SND(so) so->so_snd.sb_hiwat

1031 See static __inline uint16_t ip_newid(void) in netinet/ip_var.h

1068/* with the current included files, this is defined in Linux but
1069 * in FreeBSD, it is behind a _KERNEL in sys/socket.h ...
1070 */
1071#if defined(__DragonFly__) || defined(__FreeBSD__) || defined(__OpenBSD__) || defined(__native_client__)
1072/* stolen from /usr/include/sys/socket.h */
1073#define CMSG_ALIGN(n) _ALIGN(n)
1074#elif defined(__NetBSD__)
1075#define CMSG_ALIGN(n) (((n) + __ALIGNBYTES) & ~__ALIGNBYTES)
1076#elif defined(__APPLE__)
1077#if !defined(__DARWIN_ALIGNBYTES)
1078#define __DARWIN_ALIGNBYTES (sizeof(__darwin_size_t) - 1)
1079#endif
1080
1081#if !defined(__DARWIN_ALIGN)
1082#define __DARWIN_ALIGN(p) ((__darwin_size_t)((char *)(uintptr_t)(p) + __DARWIN_ALIGNBYTES) &~ __DARWIN_ALIGNBYTES)
1083#endif
1084
1085#if !defined(__DARWIN_ALIGNBYTES32)
1086#define __DARWIN_ALIGNBYTES32 (sizeof(__uint32_t) - 1)
1087#endif
1088
1089#if !defined(__DARWIN_ALIGN32)
1090#define __DARWIN_ALIGN32(p) ((__darwin_size_t)((char *)(uintptr_t)(p) + __DARWIN_ALIGNBYTES32) &~ __DARWIN_ALIGNBYTES32)
1091#endif
1092#define CMSG_ALIGN(n) __DARWIN_ALIGN32(n)
1093#endif
1094#define I_AM_HERE \
1095 do { \
1096 SCTP_PRINTF("%s:%d at %s\n", __FILE__, __LINE__ , __func__); \
1097 } while (0)

1099#ifndef timevalsub
1100#define timevalsub(tp1, tp2) \
1101 do { \
1102 (tp1)->tv_sec -= (tp2)->tv_sec; \
1103 (tp1)->tv_usec -= (tp2)->tv_usec; \
1104 if ((tp1)->tv_usec < 0) { \
1105 (tp1)->tv_sec--; \
1106 (tp1)->tv_usec += 1000000; \
1107 } \
1108 } while (0)
1109#endif

1111#if defined(__linux__)
1112#if !defined(TAILQ_FOREACH_SAFE)
1113#define TAILQ_FOREACH_SAFE(var, head, field, tvar) \
1114 for ((var) = ((head)->tqh_first); \
1115 (var) && ((tvar) = TAILQ_NEXT((var), field), 1); \
1116 (var) = (tvar))
1117#endif
1118#if !defined(LIST_FOREACH_SAFE)
1119#define LIST_FOREACH_SAFE(var, head, field, tvar) \
1120 for ((var) = ((head)->lh_first); \
1121 (var) && ((tvar) = LIST_NEXT((var), field), 1); \
1122 (var) = (tvar))
1123#endif
1124#endif
1125#if defined(__DragonFly__)
1126#define TAILQ_FOREACH_SAFE TAILQ_FOREACH_MUTABLE
1127#define LIST_FOREACH_SAFE LIST_FOREACH_MUTABLE
1128#endif
1129
1130#if defined(__native_client__)
1131#define timercmp(tvp, uvp, cmp) \
1132 (((tvp)->tv_sec == (uvp)->tv_sec) ? \
1133 ((tvp)->tv_usec cmp (uvp)->tv_usec) : \
1134 ((tvp)->tv_sec cmp (uvp)->tv_sec))
1135#endif

1137#define SCTP_IS_LISTENING(inp) ((inp->sctp_flags & SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_ACCEPTING) != 0)

1141timingsafe_bcmp(const void *, const void *, size_t);
